definition: to subject to severe and vexing embarrassment : shame
examples: was no longer mortified by comparisons between her sisters' beauty and her own

definition: to subdue or deaden (the body, bodily appetites, etc.) especially by abstinence or self-inflicted pain or discomfort
examples: mortified his body for spiritual purification

definition: to destroy the strength, vitality, or functioning of

examples: treated his wound so that it would not mortify
